website_summaries.verdict: Under Armour shoes usually don’t get much attention if they are not from Stephen Curry’s celebrated line. The HOVR Havoc Low just changed that. Like the high-top HOVR Havoc, these low-top basketball shoes are just killing it with their amazing traction and pretty effective cushioning system. The fact that a pair is sold for just around a hundred bucks seals the deal. This model is really the one to get if you are serious about balling.
pros: Several reviewers note that for their unbelievably low price, these Under Armour basketball shoes offer so much
Many say that the Under Armour HOVR Havoc Low feels comfortable when worn even the whole day
Stephen Curry’s sixth basketball shoe with Under Armour is also equipped with HOVR cushioning
A good number of wearers love the colors that these Under Armour shoes are released in
Some wearers that the materials that the UA HOVR Havoc Low is made of feel great
Under Armour equipped this model with good old herringbone, and reviewers say that it was a good call
One can never go wrong with herringbone, they say
The shoe gets high overall satisfaction ratings from buyers
Reviewers say that the HOVR Havoc Low from UA Basketball fairly runs true to size
At least one user says that the shoe is light
A few reviewers say that this shoe is really durable
cons: Some players are not happy that the HOVR technology did not extend up to the forefoot
These UA basketball shoes may require some serious breaking in

customer_reviews.title: HUGE FLAW
customer_reviews.text: Fits true to size. Slightly narrow around the mid foot, but materials do seem to stretch a bit. The shoes do have one huge flaw though, as the plastic heel counter rides up too high and becomes uncomfortable the more you play in it. It actually rides up so high that after about 45 min of light shoot around at my local indoor gym, I started to bleed from my ankle! Something that I have never encountered with other shoes. Greatly upsetting and something to consider when purchasing these shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Will dig into your ankle
customer_reviews.text: The plastic part in the heel that wraps around the side of the shoe will dig into your angle when you make a cut. These shoes are pretty cheap as far as materials are concerned. No padding anywhere.
customer_reviews.author: Grand Emperor Colossus

customer_reviews.title: Hovr Havoc A well rounded shoe
customer_reviews.text: The actual name of this shoe is the Under Armour Hovr Havoc(NOT Drive 5 Low) and it's an excellent basketball shoe. It has great traction for indoor or outdoor playing surfaces. The Hovr cushion is very nice making it a very comfortable shoe. When you first put them on they will feel tight, especially in the forefoot area, and very firm but you have to give yourself time to break them in as they are extremely comfortable. If you have a wide foot you may want to go up about half a size. The support is excellent as well. You feel truly locked in while playing basketball. In terms of the materials used it's all premium. I highly recommend these.
customer_reviews.author: DT

customer_reviews.title: Good shoes, but some breaking in is needed.
customer_reviews.text: These HOVR Havoc Low's run a bit small. I normally wear a 9.5, but had to return for a size 9 due to having too much space in the heel area. Once I had the right fit the shoes fit better, but have needed quite a bit of time before the cushioning felt just right. The herringbone traction is great for indoor & outdoor play and the fuse material seems pretty durable. I've had them for months now and they stay pretty clean aside from the scuffs on the white outsole. I recommend them if you play on hard court surfaces like I do.
customer_reviews.author: J.T

customer_reviews.title: Amazing sneaker but..
customer_reviews.text: As far as Basketball shoes go (inside/outside) these check every box you look for in a good quick cutting sneaker. HOWEVER, on the outside of my ankle, underneath my ankle bone the sneaker comes up to high and eats away at your skin. I tried so hard to play through it because I love these sneakers so much but its just too uncomfortable and eventually painful. This has happened to others who have bought these sneakers but some didn’t so I guess it comes down to the shape of your foot. Purchasing this online is a gamble.
customer_reviews.author: maria

customer_reviews.title: Fits very nicely!
customer_reviews.text: Usually I wore nike shoes size 10.5 and decided to try on UA after seeing one of my friends shoes. I felt like want to give more breathing room for my feet so I ordered size 11. Apparently, it feels like size 10.5 on the nike. So you better go bigger on this shoes than your normal size. The area around the angkle feels protected somehow and that's pretty cool! I've been out on a couple basketball games and this shoes feels really nice. The price difference on different color is a bit too much unfortunately.
customer_reviews.author: Adrian Gani

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe for the price and very comfortable!
customer_reviews.text: Great shoe! We had just bought our son a pretty pricey pair of basketball shoes but shortly after we got those we found out that he needed these particular shoes for an Under Armour basketball tournament. Let's just say...he ended up wearing these shoes for the entire rest of the season. He loved them! e said that they were very comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: william & charity mendez

customer_reviews.title: Perfect.
customer_reviews.text: They are comfortable, not clunky looking, and the color blue matches the school uniform perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Mom of 4 Wife of 1

customer_reviews.title: Strange fit: struggle to get it on but big in rest of shoe - abrasions below ankles from rubbing
customer_reviews.text: Strange fit: struggle to get it on - really tight at the mouth and can't stretch it open- but big in rest of shoe. Wore it once and had bloody abrasions below ankles from rubbing. Went back to wearing my old shoes. I forgot about returning and now I missed my window.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: No complaints
customer_reviews.text: This was an order from my brother and he says 2 thumbs up.
customer_reviews.author: WallyD

customer_reviews.title: UA 4 life
customer_reviews.text: Super comfortable! I now only buy UA shoes and have a dozen pairs
customer_reviews.author: David O

customer_reviews.title: Very good quality
customer_reviews.text: My 11 y/o son loved getting these as a gift
customer_reviews.author: michael w. mckitrick

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy
customer_reviews.text: Nice comfortable shoe to play ball in. My son loves these.
customer_reviews.author: DEVEREN

customer_reviews.title: Real nice basketball shoes
customer_reviews.text: I like them, fits well and feels strong. Would buy again
customer_reviews.author: Odex

customer_reviews.title: Game shoe
customer_reviews.text: For my son’s basketball team shoe. He has not complained of his feet hurting and has sensitive feet.
customer_reviews.author: micah

customer_reviews.title: No more pain in my feet or ankles at the end of the night !
customer_reviews.text: I use these shoes at work as a bartender , hands down the best shoes I have ever used doing my job !! I have been bartending over twenty years !
customer_reviews.author: Scott Viehe

customer_reviews.title: Nice shoes, a little tight in the arch
customer_reviews.text: Didn’t realize they are sick fit, but that’s my bad! A bit tight in the arch
customer_reviews.author: Derek Moore

customer_reviews.title: Nice!
customer_reviews.text: Color and fit is nice. Not used to not having a separate tongue instead of it being all one piece.
customer_reviews.author: Julie

customer_reviews.title: Thank u
customer_reviews.text: I got my sneakers on time and it fit perfectly thank you very much Amazon
customer_reviews.author: sheldon williams

customer_reviews.title: Bad fit
customer_reviews.text: Way to tight across the top of the foot. I also have narrow feet
customer_reviews.author: Donnie A.

customer_reviews.title: Worth to buy
customer_reviews.text: It’s a gift and carried it other country. Fit perfectly
customer_reviews.author: Fenny Kwan

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: The shoes are perfect! Just what I wanted and expected!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Traction
customer_reviews.text: Like this shoe because it as good traction and you should buy the shoe
customer_reviews.author: Joseph

customer_reviews.title: Just weird looking and uncomfortable
customer_reviews.text: I got these for my husband and I hate the way they look on him, his feet look huge even though they were his size. He found them very uncomfortable, he said they felt unbalanced when he walked, like he was walking on the front of his foot. He also found them to have very little traction, we were walking down our hill and he was sliding on the asphalt. They are weird shoes I would not recommend these.
customer_reviews.author: Paula G. Cannon

customer_reviews.title: Good sturdy shoe
customer_reviews.text: Great construction and the fit is perfect. The style is just what my son wanted his only complaint was the blue color and not being black. I told him to suck it up and deal. The shoe supplies ample support for walking and playing on different types of flooring and just street travel.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Every shoe is different!
customer_reviews.text: I have smaller feet that fit in smaller shoes. This shoe is really meant for smaller people. I love the fit on my feet and I have always liked a good shoe with good traction. if you are looking for traction this is your shoe! The best thing with this shoe is you never have to wipe the bottom of the shoe I have worn them on dirty courts and they don't slip one bit. The shoe didn't feel good until I had worn them for 2 or 3 games. I still feel like it could have better padding around the ankle but I love the shoe and definitely recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Shauna K.

customer_reviews.title: Heal Counter digs into ankle bone
customer_reviews.text: The TPU plastic piece that wraps around the heal of the show (with logo) absolutely destroyed my ankles.
customer_reviews.author: M. Hayward

product_meta.title: Under Armour Men's HOVR Havoc Low Basketball Shoes
product_meta.description: Our first basketball shoe built with Under Armour HOVR foam, the HOVR Havoc eliminates the impact from every cut, jump and landing made in the field. It also has a lightweight mesh upper for breathable and snug support whenever you tie it. Breathable two-tone mesh upper with TPU foil on the tip of the foot for added protection Durable synthetic overlapping panels to ensure maximum stability to the central part of the foot Exclusive connection areas integrated in the forefoot, in the central part of the foot and in the heel to ensure a personalized and strategic fit External TPU counter for efficient support The die-cut EVA midsole provides cushioning and support at the sole of the foot Under Armour HOVR technology provides a "weightlessness" feeling, favouring the return of energy and reducing the strength of the impact of each step The Energy Web compression network contains and models the Under Armour HOVR foam that returns all the energy of your steps The TPU rod in the middle wraps the foot for greater lateral stability The rubber sole adopts a herringbone pattern to offer maximum grip and grip on the ground. The anatomical flexible grooves on the forefoot allow for more natural flexibility Weight: 360 g
feature_bullets: Breathable two-tone mesh upper with TPU foil on the tip of the foot for added protection
Durable synthetic overlapping panels to ensure maximum stability to the central part of the foot
Exclusive connection areas integrated in the forefoot, in the central part of the foot and in the heel
External TPU counter for efficient support
The die-cut EVA midsole provides cushioning and support at the sole of the foot
